page.title: 09WEST MONKTON CHURCH
page.content: The church of St.Augustine of Canter- bury dates mostly from the fifteenth century.It has been added to over the years,including an Aisle which became a chapel dedicated to St.Margaret and St.Mary. At one time the church's parish was one of the largest in Somerset.Now it is fairly modest.There are a variety of parishioners,including landowners, tenant farmers,small owner occupiers & a number of craftsmen and tradesmen. They hold a service on Sunday for which they get about 30-40 people and a family and pram service on Thursdays for which they get about 60 people. About 10 people come to evening serv- ices.They have added a new red carpet, kneelers,and new service books. They have had a fire and the parish room is to be rebuilt. They have about 6 weddings a year.
